definition: to entertain/to repay/to return/to reward/to compensate/to reply/to answer

sentences.english: And in the glory there my Great Reward.
sentences.chinese: 在那光榮裏，有我偉大的酬報。

sentences.english: Beauty in the West is unninuring.
There are those who give with joy, and that joy is their reward.
sentences.chinese: 有人喜樂地施與，那喜樂就是他們的酬報。

sentences.english: The officer asked how he could reward him.
sentences.chinese: 這位軍官問如何能酬報他。

sentences.english: He is prepared to make a living by accepting any remunerative chore .
sentences.chinese: 爲了生計，他準備接受任何有酬報的雜活。

sentences.english: Good deeds are rewarded by happiness.
He is prepared to make a living by accepting any remunerative chore.
sentences.chinese: 爲了生計，他準備接受任何有酬報的雜活。

sentences.english: A patient man shall bear for a time, and afterwards joy shall be restored to him.
sentences.chinese: 忍耐的人暫時容忍，最後必有喜樂的酬報。
